content_clusters.consolidation_notes: Two articles covering role assignment and task-based role permissions merged into single cluster. Navigation map entry on role management linked as related workflow.

content_clusters.topic: Holiday Calendar and Leave Day Calculation
content_clusters.consolidation_notes: Article 14309464326929 covers public holiday calendar setup; article 14243827423889 covers daily wage calculation configuration. Both affect how leave days are calculated and deducted. Consolidated into single workflow for holiday and wage calculation setup.

Article 14314012761361 covers activating leave policies for individual employees; article 14312349012753 covers probation date management which affects leave eligibility. Both operate at employee profile level and affect leave availability.
Grouped articles covering the complete leave request lifecycle: submitting, approving/rejecting, editing, and setting up approval hierarchies. Includes both web and mobile workflows.
Consolidated articles on viewing leave balances, accrual mechanics, checking overlapping requests, and downloading leave reports for tracking and analysis.
Merged articles on calculating daily pay deductions for unpaid leave, including configuration of calculation methods and handling of public holidays.
Single article on modifying public holidays and triggering automatic leave day recalculation across leave requests.

Three articles covering foundational leave policy setup: generic leave policies, unpaid leave policies, and work-from-home policies. All follow the same workflow pattern (navigate > add new > configure > assign > confirm) with different policy-specific configurations.
Single article on configuring leave encashment for end-of-service calculations. Covers payroll integration and leave valuation methods.
Two articles covering specialized policies: days in lieu (converting extra hours to time off) and air ticket allowances. Both follow policy creation and assignment patterns.
Single article on timesheet functionality for recording daily tasks and billable hours. Covers both employee task entry and manager viewing.

Grouped tickets where the system cannot perform flexible leave calculations: shift-based day-off adjustments, custom counting rules, hourly tracking, and transparent accrual display. All affect day-to-day leave balance accuracy.

Grouped tickets specifically about carry-over allowance: inability to modify for individual cycles, no UI support for extreme values (365 days), and lack of direct UI modification. All prevent flexible leave balance rollover policies.

Grouped tickets where platform lacks region-specific compliance: UAE maternity/sick leave proration, KSA anniversary-based accrual cycles, KSA public holiday compensation. All prevent meeting local labor law requirements.
Grouped tickets where platform lacks clear documentation: no transparent UI explanation of UAE accrual calculations and custom cycles, and no clear explanation of conditional leave accrual logic.

detected_integrations.description: Days in lieu policy integrates with attendance tracking to capture extra hours worked and convert them to time off based on configured hour-to-day ratios.
Role management controls access to corporate card features and data. Specific roles can manage corporate card assignments and transactions.
Role management controls access to insurance features. Specific roles can manage employee insurance policies and claims.

Leave policies integrate with payroll for automatic salary deductions based on leave type (paid, partially paid, unpaid). Daily wage calculations use basic salary divided by 30 days. Leave encashment calculations use configured salary components (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances).
Role management controls access to performance management features. Specific roles can manage performance reviews and evaluations.

Leave policies, holiday calendars, and probation dates directly integrate with time off management. Employee structures enable automatic employee assignment in leave policies. Leave requests are affected by policy configuration, holiday calendars, and probation status.
Role management controls access to expense tracking features. Specific roles can manage employee expenses and reimbursements.
Role management controls access to Muqeem integration features. Specific roles can manage Muqeem-related data and configurations.
Role management controls access to shift scheduling features. Specific roles can manage employee shifts and schedules.
Leave policies are applied to employee profiles. Probation dates are stored in employee work tab. Leave allowances are configured at the employee profile level.
Holiday calendars are linked to employee residence location. Holidays affect leave day calculations in leave policies. Holiday configuration is required for automatic leave deduction.
Task-based role management controls who can create, assign, update, and complete tasks. Task permissions are role-dependent.
Custom roles for task management must be created by Customer Success Manager. Employees without Task Manager policy need Customer Success Manager intervention.
Employee Experience feature flag must be enabled for task creation by default employees. Controls whether non-admin employees can create tasks.

Core integration for all leave-related features. Policies define leave types, allowances, and conditions. Leave requests are submitted against configured policies. Leave balances are tracked and enforced.
Line Manager and Time Off Manager permissions are assigned through role management to control who can approve leave requests.
Leave requests, timesheet entries, and policy visibility are available on mobile app. Cross-platform synchronization ensures consistent data across web and mobile interfaces.
Leave request submissions trigger notifications to approvers. Status changes (approval, rejection) are communicated to employees via email.
Bulk upload of reporting hierarchies and download of leave reports in Excel format for data analysis and backup.
Leave policies require pre-configured employee salaries to calculate daily wages and deductions. Salary data is used for leave encashment calculations during end-of-service processing.

Employee probation dates stored in work profiles are used to enforce leave restrictions during probation. Employee seniority and location data can be used for conditional leave allowances and air ticket policy variations.
Timesheet functionality is integrated with the Work Life Platform, allowing employees to record daily tasks and hours. Data is synchronized across web and mobile applications.
Leave policies are assigned to employees and affect their leave eligibility and balance calculations. Policy deletions impact employee leave history and data integrity.
Leave policy audit trails and historical data are required for compliance reporting and leave usage analytics. Lack of audit trails limits reporting capabilities.
Leave calculation system cannot dynamically adjust based on shift scheduler day-off configurations. System ignores actual shift schedules when calculating leave entitlements.

what_to_do.task: Create and configure leave policies with accrual, calculation method, and pay rates

- Set number of leave days threshold
- Define pay rates (fully paid, partially paid, or unpaid)

Payroll deductions occur automatically when leave requests meet specified conditions. Existing leave requests may move to Pending state if calculation method is changed.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Policy Parameters Cannot Be Modified After Creation
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform does not support granular editing of leave policy parameters (carry-over days, accrual frequency, policy type) after initial creation. Administrators must completely reconfigure policies or request backend intervention to change simple settings like carry-over limits or accrual frequency. This creates significant administrative overhead and prevents mid-lifecycle policy adjustments.
what_to_watch_out_for.documented_workaround: Complete policy reconfiguration or manual backend SQL updates required

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Deleted Leave Policies Cannot Be Restored
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: When a leave policy is deleted, the platform lacks a self-service recovery mechanism. Associated leave requests and historical data cannot be fully restored, forcing manual recreation of data by support teams. This creates data loss risk and requires backend intervention for recovery.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Calculation Logic Does Not Account for Complex Schedules
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform's leave calculation logic has multiple gaps: it cannot automatically account for scheduled shift days-off in working days calculations, does not support flexible negative balance thresholds, cannot distinguish between calendar days and working days for eligibility, and does not provide transparent accrual breakdowns to employees. This results in inaccurate leave balances for employees with complex shift schedules and unclear leave accounting.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Cycle Transitions Require Backend Intervention and Risk Data Loss
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform lacks a seamless, self-service method to transition between leave cycle types (e.g., individual to calendar). Changing leave cycles requires specialized configuration team intervention and results in loss of existing leave-related historical data. Additionally, carry-over allowance configuration lacks straightforward UI controls and granular customization options.
what_to_watch_out_for.documented_workaround: Contact configuration team for manual intervention

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Request Validation and Flexibility Gaps
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform lacks automated validation for leave request timing relative to employee absences, requiring managers to manually review leave history. Additionally, the system does not support hourly leave requests (only full-day or half-day), limiting flexibility for nuanced workforce scheduling. Documentation about leave policy behavior (e.g., carry-over handling for different policy types) is unclear, causing confusion among support teams and users.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Policy Visibility and Audit Trail Limitations
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform lacks user-accessible controls for leave policy ordering in employee views (policies are auto-sorted by update time without manual prioritization). There is no audit trail for leave policy modifications, preventing administrators and employees from independently viewing the history of policy changes. Complex multi-level policy configurations (policy-level vs employee-level) lack transparency, making manual overrides difficult to track.

Once the 'reduce accrued days' feature is enabled on a leave policy, the platform does not provide a UI option to disable it. Disabling the feature requires backend intervention, creating administrative overhead and user experience friction.

The platform applies rigid leave calculations that cannot adapt to shift-based schedules, custom counting rules, or hourly tracking. System cannot dynamically adjust leave based on day-off configurations in shift scheduler, cannot handle non-working day inclusions, and cannot track leaves below 0.5-day increments. Accrual calculation logic is not transparently displayed to users.

The platform does not support carry-over allowance configuration for companies with individual leave cycles. UI does not allow modification of carry-over settings directly, and cannot handle extreme values (e.g., 365 days for unlimited carry-over). Backend intervention is required for configuration changes.

The platform lacks native support for region-specific labor law requirements: (1) UAE maternity and sick leave cannot be configured without automatic proration based on hire date, conflicting with UAE labor law; (2) KSA sick leave accrual cannot be configured on an anniversary-based individual cycle, defaulting to calendar year; (3) KSA public holiday compensation days cannot be automatically granted when holidays fall on employee weekends.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Policy Modification & Hire Date Change Handling
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform has rigid validation rules that prevent leave policy modifications when existing leave requests conflict with proposed changes, and does not automatically reconcile leave balances during policy reconfiguration. When an employee's hire date is modified (especially for individual leave cycles), the system does not automatically recalculate leave cycle dates and policy assignments. Administrative changes that modify leave requests are not transparently communicated to users.

The system cannot automatically calculate leave balance when leave policies are configured before an employee's hire date, particularly when the employee is in an inactive status. This creates a gap in automatic leave balance initialization and requires manual intervention.

The platform lacks transparent documentation and clear user interface explanations for leave accrual calculations, particularly for UAE labor law compliance, custom leave cycles, probationary periods, and conditional leave accrual logic. Users cannot easily understand how pro-rata calculations are performed and must rely on support team interpretation.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Policy UI Data Handling Edge Cases
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform has a user interface limitation in handling zero values for maximum encashable days in leave policies. The system fails to correctly interpret and display encashable days when the policy is configured with zero maximum days.
